messages: fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (00:54): images in my resource file are showing up in qt designer but when i compile and run, they arent showing. Can anyone help?
277707123b947baecdfe3cb34f39afa5 (01:09): hi, does somebody know what QCoreApplication::compressEvent do ?
277707123b947baecdfe3cb34f39afa5 (01:09): I get crashes from it at exit
277707123b947baecdfe3cb34f39afa5 (01:10): (well after app.exec() ) is finished
277707123b947baecdfe3cb34f39afa5 (01:10): and I only get this crash if I had several windows open
277707123b947baecdfe3cb34f39afa5 (01:27): ok, it was a side effect of me not destroying one of my windows
1013548dc5913beafa1c176ce18e4e7d (01:30): we should always destroy windows(r)
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:38): rioch: how do you load them?
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:40): load them? I have the icon set in qt designer
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:40): ok
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:40): and you compile with qmake?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:40): have you specified the resource file in the .pro file?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:40): like:
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:40): RESOURCES += imperium.qrc
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:41): yup
abe59155aa41ae19e4ea964e9dd4b200 (01:41): http://www.bagdadsoftware.de")
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:42): thats in there too
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:42): hm
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:42): no errors during resource compilation either?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:42): bad file format? ie gif
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:44): i mean some file format that qt doesn't really know how to load
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:44): compile your app with debug enabled, there could be some nice output on stdout
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:44): using png's and no errors at all
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:44): using debug mode already :)
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:45): looked in the file generated and it seems to have loaded the images. (cant be sure because it is compress hex values!! :) )
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:49): well, i'm at loss there
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:49): me too :) hehe
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:49): it's strange because qtdesigner will load them during editing and preview.
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (01:50): yeah
fbfedfb15e614ed20810ddeab18f0552 (01:58): i give up. time to sleep :)
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:03): How do I force Qt (4) to compile with a certain compiler instead of just "g++"?
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:03): I've tried setting CC, CXX, running QMAKE with CC and CXX, running configure with it, etc
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:04): what's the "right" way?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:04): qt itself or qt apps?
9474ba399096ff37bbecd59019e98cf6 (02:04): Maybe you want to use -platform?
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:04): chakie, I'll start with just qt itself
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:05): I want to use a wrapper around g++ called apg++
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:05): (part of the autopackage project: http://autopackage.org/apbuild-apgcc.php)
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:08): Oh, and is there an easy way to disable the examples? (other than hacking the qmake file)
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:08): dunno about that
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:08): have a look at the mkspecs dir
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:09): maybe copy the linux-g++ one and adapt the compiler flags you need there
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:10): perhaps there is a better way to do it
9474ba399096ff37bbecd59019e98cf6 (02:10): tmorton: *nix?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:10): specify the new "compiler" with -plaform whateve-you-name-it as bjoernen said
9474ba399096ff37bbecd59019e98cf6 (02:11): tmorton: You can change mkspecs/common/g++.conf as well I believe.
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:11): the linux-g++ config includes that one, yes
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:13): It builds using the mkspecs in the Qt4 dir, rigt?
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:13): yeah
42fee2a0902ee4030b62f60334158619 (02:13): Hmm, I don't have mkspecs/common in 4.1.4 (Linux, Open Source)
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:13): ok, so see mkspecs/linux-g++
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:14): maybe it's all there then
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:14): 4.2 seems to have broken out a "common" dir
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:14): it's the only source i have around
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:15): heh
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (02:15): it should be simple if your wrapper is just a thin wrapper around g++
